VPS Drivers
IMPORTANT NOTE
The interfaces defined in this package are bound to change. Release notes/user guide list the additional limitation/restriction of this module/interfaces. See also TI Disclaimer.

VPS video Drivers allow users to make use of all video hardware features like 1080P capture, HDMI/LCD/SDTV display, deinterlacing, scaling. A user can use the drivers in many different ways like multi-channel capture, memory to memory processing, display and so on. This document has detailed API description that user's can use to make use of the VPS drivers.

Also refer to VPS driver user guide for detailed features, limitations and usage description.

The VPS driver API can be broadly divided into the following categories

  • FVID2 API (See FVID2 API)
    API used to create, control and use the different VPS drivers
  • VPS (Video Processing Sub-system) API
    API for all video drivers
    • VPS Common API (See VPS - Common API)
    • VPS Control Driver API (See VPS Control driver API)
    • VPS Capture API (See Capture API) API for video capture drivers
      • VPS VIP Capture API API specific to VIP capture driver
      • VPS ISS Capture Driver API API specific to ISS capture driver
      • VPS DSSWB Capture API API specific to DSS WB capture driver
    • VPS Display API (See Display API) API for video display drivers
    • VPS Display Controller API (See Display Controller API) API for controlling and configuring VENCs in the display subsystem
    • VPS Memory to Memory (M2M) API (See M2M API and M2M Interface API) API for memory to memory drivers
      • M2M VPE API API specific to VPE M2M driver
      • M2M ISS API API specific to ISS M2M driver
      • DSS M2M Interface API API specific to DSS M2M writeback driver
  • External Device API (See External Device Interface API)
    API for controlling external video devices like video decoders, video encoders, video filters, IO expanders, Ultra-sonic sensors
    • See External Video Decoder API
    • See External Camera Sensor API
    • See External Video Encoder API
    • See External IO Expander API
    • See PGA450 Ultra-sonic Sensor API
    • See PGA460 Ultra-sonic Sensor API
  • Platform Specific API (See Platform Specific API)
    API for platform/board specific control, like setting pin muxes, clocks etc
  • Board Specific API (See Board API)
    API for board specific features.

In addition to above drivers the VPS package also includes many sample examples which show how to use the drivers in different ways. Many of these sample examples use a common set of APIs which a user may find useful to refer to for use in their final application.

  • Utility library API (See Sample Example - Utility library API)
    APIs used by sample application for allocating memory, exchanging buffers, measuring performamce and so on
